, the Vicar of Norton, came to see me about the appointment to S. Michael's, Norton, which is in his gift. He wants to appoint his son
, but I was decisively hostile to a gross act of nepotism. I sent him off after lunch, a sadder, if not a wiser, man, bidding him reconsider the whole question in the light of our conversation.
and I walked around the Park. The fineness of the weather and the freshness of the air made walking very pleasant.
